availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Requisitions for the Return of Fugitives from Justice, 1863-1867

body.p:
The Commonwealth of Kentucky,
To Any Sheriff Constable, Marshall or Police officer of said Commonwealth,

From information ^on^ oath, given to me by Thos Forman of Jefferson County, There are reasonable grounds for believing, That one Mathew Skifington, now Residing at Peoria in the County of Illinois, did on the 1st day of July last, Steal, take, and carry off from the person of Said Thos Forman, of Jefferson County, a Gold Watch, and chain, the property of said Thos Forman, Said watch is a heavy ^magic^ double cased watch, with the name of Wm Reader engraved upon the inside case, and with a square & compas, also three links engraved on the back of the inside case, and a very heavy Gold chain usually known a a vest chain, and worth in the Sum of Five Hundred dollars, -- These are therefore to command you in the name of the Commonwealth to forthwith arrest the said Mathew Skifington if he befound within said state, and to take him before some Police Judge
or Justice of the Peace having jurisdiction in cases of Felony, that he may be tried according to law, and have there then this writ.
Given under my hand as Justice of the Peace for Jefferson County this 12th day of October 1865
Saml Matlack J. P J. C

Requisition on Gov Illoinois
&
The Commonwealth of Kentucky
vs } order for arrest
Mathew Skiffington
Wm Hipwell apptd Agent
13 Oct/65
